result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Anthony J. Pecha was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Anthony J. Pecha was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J. Pecha

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Anthony J. Pecha in court with attorney Barry S. Cohen.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:37 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Yackel 01 CT 95 Chippewa County case - 6th offense OWI amended info.  Court grants motion to file amended information as to OWI 6th.  Atty Cohen waived reading of amended information.  Court advised the defendant as to the amended information counts 1 and 2 have been amended to a 6th offense.  Atty yackel - plead to count 1 as amended - count 2 DRI .20 - plead to count 3 and count 4 DRI as to count 1:  12 mo jail - $2500.00 - 36 mo revocation - count 3 Sentence w/held 2 years probation costs.  Atty Cohen agrees as does the defendant.  Court questions the defendant as to the plea questionnaire.  Stipulate to probable cause portion of complaint, both Attorney's   Defendant entered G plea as to counts 1 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1 and 3 and counts 2 and 4 are dismissed and used as read-ins.    Parties are waiving preliminary exam.  Court so finds.  Atty Yackel makes arguement as to sentencing defendant has done well with STOP.  Court makes stmt.  Atty Cohen makes stmt. Court makes further stmt.  Atty Cohen makes stmt.  Court questions Atty Cohen as to defendant's residency.  Atty Cohen asks court to hold the question as to drug court.   Atty Cohen makes arguement to sentencing.  Court taking judicial notice to Barron County case. Court questions the defendant as to what he learned in STOP.

COURT:  Count 1 :   12 months home detention 973.03 in lieu of county jail credit for 3  days time served begin immediately- $2500.00 fine - 36 month dl revocation plus 12 months - IID for 36 months beginning 8/20/15  - Driver assessment and VIP which he has completed - all vehicles in his name to have IID - set up payment plan today  Bond to be applied to this fine

Count 3:  Impose/Stay  - 3 years 6 months - 1 yr 6 mo in and balance 1 yr 6 mo ES consecutive count 1 - eligible for earned release program - 
probation for 2 years consecutive to count 1 - costs -

$1,000 combined bond ($500 signature component, $500 cash component) with conditions as follows:

 SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Random Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
